name: Mountains of Mist
description: A range of cloud-capped peaks, the source of the cold wind, visible from Emond's Field. Known for harsh winters.

name: Sand Hills
description: An area east of the Mountains of Mist, once the shore of a great ocean. Considered bad luck by some in the Two Rivers.

name: Two Rivers
description: The general region where the story is set, known for its stubborn people, fertile land, and sheep farming. It includes villages like Emond's Field, Watch Hill, and Deven Ride.

name: Westwood
description: A tangled forest within the Two Rivers, bordering Emond's Field. Only the hardiest men farm here, and it feels unusually foreboding.

name: Quarry Road
description: A rock-strewn track where Rand and Tam are traveling at the beginning of the chapter.

name: Emond’s Field
description: The main village where Rand and Tam live, situated close to the Westwood. It is bustling with preparations for the Bel Tine Festival.

name: Winespring Inn
description: The prominent inn in Emond's Field, owned by Bran al'Vere. It stands at the east end of the Green and serves as a central gathering place, built with river rock and older stone, featuring a whitewashed second story and red roof tiles.

name: The Green
description: A broad, central expanse in Emond's Field, usually covered in thick grass, but currently showing patches of dead grass and bare earth. It is the primary site for Bel Tine Festival activities, including fires and the Spring Pole.

name: Winespring
description: A gushing natural spring located near The Green in Emond's Field, renowned for its strong flow and sweet water, giving its name to the inn and the local water source.

name: Winespring Water
description: A rapidly widening stream that flows swiftly east from the Winespring, passing Master Thane's mill before splitting into many streams in the Waterwood.

name: Waterwood
description: A swampy area with numerous streams and ponds, located beyond the last farms east of Emond's Field. It's where Rand learned to swim.

name: Watch Hill
description: A village north of Emond's Field, accessible via the North Road. Mentioned as a common destination within the Two Rivers.

name: Deven Ride
description: A village south of Emond's Field, accessible via the Old Road. Mentioned as a common destination within the Two Rivers.

name: Taren Ferry
description: A location north of Emond's Field, connected by the North Road. Its inhabitants are stereotyped as untrusting.

name: Baerlon
description: A town from which merchants travel to Emond's Field for goods like wool or tabac, and from where the gleeman was brought.

name: Shayol Ghul
description: A mythical, legendary location where the Dark One and the Forsaken are said to be bound, beyond the Great Blight.

name: Great Blight
description: A legendary dangerous region associated with Shayol Ghul, where the Dark One is bound.

name: Master Thane's mill
description: A mill located along the Winespring Water, east of Emond's Field.

name: North Road
description: A road leading north from Emond's Field, connecting to Watch Hill and Taren Ferry, which becomes the Old Road at the Wagon Bridge.

name: Old Road
description: A road leading south from Emond's Field, connecting to Deven Ride, which is the continuation of the North Road at the Wagon Bridge.

name: Wagon Bridge
description: A sturdy bridge wider than others, located near the Winespring Inn, marking the transition point between the North Road and the Old Road in Emond's Field.
